disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents by refusing their reasonable requests?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

extracted_data_phrases: by failing to follow their reasonable instructions
disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents by failing to follow their reasonable instructions?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Have I rejected the unity of the Church when frustrated with individuals within it?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

extracted_data_phrases: of fasting , such as Ash Wednesday , which are prescribed by the Church to practice self - denial and penance

disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

extracted_data_phrases: especially during sacred times such as Ash Wednesday
disobedience.question: Did you deliberately disregard prescribed days of fasting, especially during sacred times such as Ash Wednesday, by skipping them?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did you speak disrespectfully to someone within the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: from staying away from Sacraments or Mass by discouraging them verbally
condoning.question: Did I condone other Catholics from staying away from Sacraments or Mass by discouraging them verbally?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: from attending Sacraments or Mass by my words
condoning.question: Did I discourage other Catholics from attending Sacraments or Mass by my words?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

extracted_data_phrases: from staying away from Sacraments by your words
condoning.question: Did you condone other Catholics from staying away from Sacraments by your words, encouraging them to postpone receiving spiritual nourishment?
condoning.description: One of the spiritual works of mercy is to admonish the sinner and to correct them out of love and charity instead of condoning sin.

condoning.question: Did I permit my child to persist in ignorance, failing to address concerns that were difficult to confront?
condoning.description: Permitting a child to continue in error by avoiding difficult conversations is sinful because it neglects our God-given parental duty to guide and form our children's moral and spiritual development, placing our own comfort above their eternal wellbeing.

condoning.question: Did you condone a funeral where human remains were scattered or otherwise disposed of without reverent burial?
condoning.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

condoning.question: Did I condone another Catholic to marry outside the Church through my words?

uncharity.question: Do I dehumanize others based on their job, nationality, or other trait?

uncharity.question: Did I allow my family's needs, especially those of my children, to take precedence over my own interests?
uncharity.description: This is considered sinful because excessive self-focus and selfishness violates Christ's command to love our neighbors as ourselves and contradicts the Christian call to practice charity, compassion, and self-sacrifice for others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that disregards their dignity as children of God

uncharity.description: Treating others with disrespect denies their inherent dignity as beings created in God's image and violates Christ's command to love one another as He has loved us.

uncharity.question: Do you habitually think negative thoughts about others, failing to regard them as beloved children of God?
uncharity.description: Treating others with disrespect denies their inherent dignity as beings created in God's image and violates Christ's command to love one another as He has loved us.

uncharity.question: Did I lose my patience with others, allowing irritation to surface in our conversations?
uncharity.description: Losing patience with others fails to reflect God's infinite patience with us and violates Christ's command to love our neighbor, instead allowing anger and frustration to override charity and kindness.

uncharity.question: Did I permit someone else to be treated unfairly?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

extracted_data_phrases: particularly in situations where I have influence or authority over their circumstances
uncharity.question: Did I permit someone else to be treated unfairly in my daily interactions, particularly in situations where I have influence or authority over their circumstances?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Did you permit someone to be treated unfairly by your actions, even if it was unintentional?
uncharity.description: This sin violates the principles of justice, charity, and our moral obligation to defend human dignity and protect our neighbors from harm when we have the ability to intervene.

uncharity.question: Have I not been available to others when they needed my assistance?
uncharity.description: Refusing to help those in need violates Jesus's direct command to love our neighbor and practice the works of mercy, as illustrated in the parable of the Good Samaritan.

extracted_data_phrases: to family members , neighbors , and community members who are struggling or in need
uncharity.question: Have I shown compassion and practical assistance to family members, neighbors, and community members who are struggling or in need?
uncharity.description: Failing to help those in need violates Christ's direct command to love our neighbor and care for the poor, effectively refusing to recognize Jesus Himself in the suffering of others.

merciless.question: Have I spoken harshly to others, condemning them in my words?
merciless.description: Condemning others is a sin of mercilessness because it places oneself in God's role as judge and denies others the same mercy and forgiveness that God extends to all of us.

callousness.question: Did you fail to assist someone who was suffering when they needed your help, although you had the means to provide it?
callousness.description: As part of the corporal works of mercy, we're called to be merciful and compassionate to those in distress.

extracted_data_phrases: from caring for someone in need

extracted_data_phrases: for my charitable actions towards others

vainglory.description: Seeking praise for charitable giving is sinful because it transforms an act meant to glorify God and help others into an exercise of pride and self-glorification.

oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did you take for granted the blessings in your life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: for accomplishments in my family life
autonomy.question: Did I take credit for accomplishments in my family life, forgetting to acknowledge God's providence as their source?

by taking them for granted rather than acknowledging His providence

autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I envied others' blessings, wishing they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished that others would lose their blessings, so I could feel less burdened by my own perceived shortcomings in this area?

envy.question: Have I felt envious when others achieve success or receive blessings that I feel I am lacking?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use words that were unbecoming to others, causing them undue harm or offense?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control and speak to others with language that was unbecoming of their dignity?

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, compromising your self-control and moderation?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing or discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger or held onto feelings of rage rather than seeking reconciliation in my relationships, especially when disagreements arise among family members or close friends?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.

anger.question: Have I nursed anger or held onto feelings of rage rather than seeking reconciliation in my relationships, particularly those that involve parenting my children?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
